page.title: 08Watford: General Hospital
page.content: On May 9th. 1985 the new Watford General Hospital was opened in Vicarage Road. The original building was the workhouse which was opened in 1830. Since then other buildings were opened to house Shrodells Wing of Watford Hospital now with further new buildings the hospitals caters for patients from all over the Watford area. There are 25 wards. It costs Â£308,000 a year to run the Hospital. 1,700 people are employed there including doctors, nurses, cleaners, electricians,maintenance men, cooks and laundry workers. The Hospital deals with an average of 120 accidents a day, the most minor being cuts. There are many different departments such as maternity, x-ray, physio- therapy, psychiatric and geriatric. There are plans to build more extensions in the future.
